episode_summary: This episode covers a variety of intriguing topics, including the cultural promotion of kimchi by the South Korean government, a railway tunnel in Derbyshire built to appease a Duke, the story of Les Paul's arm being fused to play guitar, and the use of swimming pools by firefighters to combat fires.

facts.fact: If you like kimchi, you're a victim of government propaganda.
There is an entire railway tunnel in Derbyshire, which was constructed so the railway could be hidden from the Duke of Rutland.
Legendary guitar maker, Les Paul, had his arm permanently fused at roughly a 90 degree angle so that he could forever strum a guitar.
Firefighters are allowed to scoop water out of people's swimming pools to put out fires.
